item.title: Jesse add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "Anti-intellectualism has been a constant thread winding its way through our political and cultural life, nurtured by the false notion that democracy means that <i>'my ignorance is just as good as your knowledge.'</i>" -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: Jesse add a quote by Jerry A. Fodor
item.description: "Self-pity can make one weep, as can onions." -- Jerry A. Fodor

item.title: Jesse add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The History of every major Galactic Civilization tends to pass through three distinct and recognizable phases, those of Survival, Inquiry and Sophistication, otherwise known as the How, Why, and Where phases. For instance, the first phase is characterized by the question 'How can we eat?' the second by the question 'Why do we eat?' and the third by the question 'Where shall we have lunch?" -- Douglas Adams
